name: USCoreDocumentReferenceProfile
title: US Core DocumentReference Profile
description: To promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation, this profile sets minimum expectations for searching and fetching patient documents including Clinical Notes using the DocumentReference resource. It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present and constrains the way the elements are used when using the profile. It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases. Prior to reviewing this profile, implementers are encouraged to read the Clinical Notes Guidance to understand the overlap of US Core DocumentReference Profile and US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Report and Note exchange.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: masterIdentifier
elements.description: Document identifier as assigned by the source of the document. This identifier is specific to this version of the document. This unique identifier may be used elsewhere to identify this version of the document.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Other identifiers associated with the document, including version independent identifiers.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status of this document reference.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: interim: .completionCode="IN" & ./statusCode[isNormalDatatype()]="active";  final: .completionCode="AU" &&  ./statusCode[isNormalDatatype()]="complete" and not(./inboundRelationship[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#CACT") and moodCode="EVN" and domainMember("ReviseDocument", code) and isNormalAct()]);  amended: .completionCode="AU" &&  ./statusCode[isNormalDatatype()]="complete" and ./inboundRelationship[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#CACT") and moodCode="EVN" and domainMember("ReviseDocument", code) and isNormalAct() and statusCode="completed"];  withdrawn : .completionCode=NI &&  ./statusCode[isNormalDatatype()]="obsolete"

elements.name: docStatus
elements.description: The status of the underlying document.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.description: Specifies the particular kind of document referenced  (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note). This usually equates to the purpose of making the document referenced.

binding.description: All LOINC  values whose SCALE is DOC in the LOINC database and the HL7 v3 Code System NullFlavor concept 'unknown'

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map:
ClinicalDocument/code/@code 

The typeCode should be mapped from the ClinicalDocument/code element to a set of document type codes configured in the affinity domain. One suggested coding system to use for typeCode is LOINC, in which case the mapping step can be omitted.

elements.name: category
elements.description: A categorization for the type of document referenced - helps for indexing and searching. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the DocumentReference.type.

binding.description: High-level kind of a clinical document at a macro level.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Derived from a mapping of /ClinicalDocument/code/@code to an Affinity Domain specified coded value to use and coding system. Affinity Domains are encouraged to use the appropriate value for Type of Service, based on the LOINC Type of Service (see Page 53 of the LOINC User's Manual). Must be consistent with /ClinicalDocument/code/@code

elements.name: category
elements.description: A categorization for the type of document referenced - helps for indexing and searching. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the DocumentReference.type.

binding.description: The US Core DocumentReferences Type Value Set is a "starter set" of categories supported for fetching and storing clinical notes. Note that other codes are permitted, see [Required Bindings When Slicing by Value Sets](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/general-requirements.html#required-bindings-when-slicing-by-valuesets)

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Derived from a mapping of /ClinicalDocument/code/@code to an Affinity Domain specified coded value to use and coding system. Affinity Domains are encouraged to use the appropriate value for Type of Service, based on the LOINC Type of Service (see Page 53 of the LOINC User's Manual). Must be consistent with /ClinicalDocument/code/@code

elements.name: subject
elements.short: (USCDI) Who/what is the subject of the document
elements.description: Who or what the document is about. The document can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (e.g. a machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of farm animals, or a set of patients that share a common exposure).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: PID-3 (No standard way to define a Practitioner or Group subject in HL7 v2 MDM message)

elements.name: date
elements.short: (USCDI) When this document reference was created
elements.description: When the document reference was created.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: author
elements.short: (USCDI) Who and/or what authored the document
elements.description: Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: TXA-9 (No standard way to indicate a Device in HL7 v2 MDM message)

elements.name: authenticator
elements.description: Which person or organization authenticates that this document is valid.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: custodian
elements.description: Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the document.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: relatesTo
elements.description: Relationships that this document has with other document references that already exist.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: code
elements.description: The type of relationship that this document has with anther document.

binding.description: The type of relationship between documents.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: target
elements.description: The target document of this relationship.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.description: Human-readable description of the source document.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: securityLabel
elements.description: A set of Security-Tag codes specifying the level of privacy/security of the Document. Note that DocumentReference.meta.security contains the security labels of the "reference" to the document, while DocumentReference.securityLabel contains a snapshot of the security labels on the document the reference refers to.

binding.description: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: content
elements.description: The document and format referenced. There may be multiple content element repetitions, each with a different format.

elements.name: attachment
elements.description: The document or URL of the document along with critical metadata to prove content has integrity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
DocumentReference.content.attachment.url or DocumentReference.content.attachment.data or both SHALL be present.

mapping.map: DocumentEntry.mimeType, DocumentEntry.languageCode, DocumentEntry.URI, DocumentEntry.size, DocumentEntry.hash, DocumentEntry.title, DocumentEntry.creationTime

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: contentType
elements.short: (USCDI) Mime type of the content, with charset etc.
elements.description: Identifies the type of the data in the attachment and allows a method to be chosen to interpret or render the data. Includes mime type parameters such as charset where appropriate.

binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: ED.2+ED.3/RP.2+RP.3. Note conversion may be needed if old style values are being used

elements.name: language
elements.description: The human language of the content. The value can be any valid value according to BCP 47.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: data
elements.description: The actual data of the attachment - a sequence of bytes, base64 encoded.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: url
elements.short: (USCDI) Uri where the data can be found
elements.description: A location where the data can be accessed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RP.1+RP.2 - if they refer to a URL (see v2.6)

elements.name: size
elements.short: Number of bytes of content (if url provided)
elements.description: The number of bytes of data that make up this attachment (before base64 encoding, if that is done).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: hash
elements.description: The calculated hash of the data using SHA-1. Represented using base64.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: title
elements.short: Label to display in place of the data
elements.description: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: creation
elements.description: The date that the attachment was first created.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: format
elements.description: An identifier of the document encoding, structure, and template that the document conforms to beyond the base format indicated in the mimeType.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: derived from the IHE Profile or Implementation Guide templateID

elements.name: context
elements.description: The clinical context in which the document was prepared.

elements.name: encounter
elements.description: Describes the clinical encounter or type of care that the document content is associated with.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: unique(highest(./outboundRelationship[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalActRelationship()], priorityNumber)/target[moodCode="EVN" and classCode=("ENC", "PCPR") and isNormalAct])

elements.name: event
elements.description: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented. In some cases, the event is inherent in the type Code, such as a "History and Physical Report" in which the procedure being documented is necessarily a "History and Physical" act.

binding.description: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts being documented.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: period
elements.short: (USCDI) Time of service that is being documented
elements.description: The time period over which the service that is described by the document was provided.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: facilityType
elements.short: Kind of facility where patient was seen
elements.description: The kind of facility where the patient was seen.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: usually from a mapping to a local ValueSet
usually a mapping to a local ValueSet. Must be consistent with /clinicalDocument/code

elements.name: practiceSetting
elements.short: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)
elements.description: This property may convey specifics about the practice setting where the content was created, often reflecting the clinical specialty.

binding.description: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: usually from a mapping to a local ValueSet
usually from a mapping to a local ValueSet

elements.name: sourcePatientInfo
elements.description: The Patient Information as known when the document was published. May be a reference to a version specific, or contained.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: related
elements.description: Related identifiers or resources associated with the DocumentReference.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
